p: The overall complication rate of TAPP repair is low because of technological advances. Statistical data indicate that the incidence of SBO after TAPP repair ranges from 0.2% to 0.5% ( 5) and is usually attributed to inadequate peritoneal closure, trocar site herniation, or adhesion ( 6). We identified other case reports similar to ours, in which a self-anchoring barbed suture remained after TAPP repair and caused SBO ( 7, 8). Although such cases are rare, they provide many clinical learning points.
